ComicInfo.Title: The Truth Hurtz- The Mid-70s; Edward L. Warren; Portrait of an Artist as a Young Alessio Easelsmear; The Buffoon's Tale; Stanton K. Pragmatron - Part of a New Breed; Cartoon Genius
ComicInfo.Summary:
The Truth Hurtz- The Mid-70s: Sacco comes clean with the embarrassing things he and others did during the mid-70s.
Edward L. Warren: An honest portrait of Edward L. Warren, one of Sacco's college buddies.
Portrait of an Artist as a Young Alessio Easelsmear: A send-up of bohemian affectation in this story of a painter who leeches off a wealthy woman thirty years older than him.
The Buffoon's Tale: A Brueghel-inspired tale about a Cooper's daughter who avoids being burned at the stake when people in the village start defecating riches instead of stool.
Stanton K. Pragmatron - Part of a New Breed: A send up of bare-knuckled capitalism as the title character does anything he can to get to the top.
Cartoon Genius: Sacco mocks the self-righteousness of starving artists in this depiction of his struggle to make a living as an artist.
